name: chagrined
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
feeling disappointed or angry, especially by a failure or mistake: He was staring at the ruined bike with a horribly chagrined expression. She feels a little chagrined at being filmed without her knowledge. See
chagrin
More examplesFewer examplesHe looked a bit chagrined as he stood in airport baggage claim after a 22-hour flight.I went to our chagrined guest almost immediately and apologized.School officials were chagrined to see the two campuses merged.
